website_summaries.verdict: This brush/scraper combo gives you the option of pushing off snow before you scrape.
pros: Long length gives extra reach, especially for wide windshields
scraper isn't the best we've seen but gets the job done
cons: Scraper should not touch car paint, as it could leave a mark

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Don't buy this. The bristles of the brush all fell out the first time I used it. It was even a light snow so there's no reason this should happen. Scraper portion seems fine. Update: been using the scraper side for less than a year and it’s gotten where it’s not very effective. Only scrapes in the middle—about half the length of the blade. Still terrible. Update: in garbage where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Chemical use
customer_reviews.text: There is a warning on this product handle about chemicals used to make it. If you are of child bearing years or have children in your vehicle, the product has a warning not to have skin contact with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Does not do its job
customer_reviews.text: I had barely used this product for 30 seconds when bristles started falling off. When I noticed them on my car, I looked on the ground, and there were more there, as well. I grabbed a couple bristles to see how easily I could pull them off, and before even really pulling at all, they detached from the brush. I don't see how anyone is able to use this product. It is cheaply made and does not do what it is meant to do at all. I will be expecting a refund, as this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: Swing and a miss
customer_reviews.text: Purchased due to the season being what it is; ice and snow. Received promptly and thankfully before the freeze. Problem is, the scraper I was sent had a rolled edge to the "blade" thay caused it to scrape the ice about as well as my fingenails would. I could probably clean up the edge with a file to make this thing usable, and probably will, but should I have to? But hey, at least the brush works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Flaxon

customer_reviews.title: I bought this one along with the slightly less expensive Amazon Basics one and would easily recommend the Amazon Basics one over this one
customer_reviews.text: The padding around the handle seems a bit loose. I bought this one along with the slightly less expensive Amazon Basics one and would easily recommend the Amazon Basics one over this one... though they are both nearly identical. The bristles on this one seem less sturdy and the cut of the plastic on the end isn't as good as the Amazon Basics one. The scraper part and overall construction of the plastic piece seems very durable, but the foam padding is what concerns me the most.
customer_reviews.author: YeGoose

customer_reviews.title: Scratched my windshield and then fell apart. Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This was a piece of junk. The scraper scratched my windshield the first time I used it to scrape the ice off my windshield. The scraper later fell off. It was just glued onto the bottom of the rod. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Pelsssss

customer_reviews.title: Good snow brush
customer_reviews.text: Decent snow brush now that I've actually received a proper one. I've had better ones, but for the price I paid for this I'm more than satisfied. Especially now that Amazon replaced my first broken one. Double check yours before you use it, otherwise you could end up damaging your car or breaking the snow brush without knowing it was defective/damaged in the first place. Especially with how the company tried to hide the damage from the first one I received. Hopefully it lasts as long as my previous one. Had that one for years, finally decided to retire it.
customer_reviews.author: JYLY

customer_reviews.title: Works great, super grip
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these, one for my Titan XD Pro-4X pickup (which needs a VERY long reach to clear the center of the windshield) and one for my wife's Toyota Prius (which most assuredly does not :-) ). The scraper and brush work fine, but the feature I most appreciate is the grip, which is very comfortable to use because of the cushioning and the ribbed design, which makes it easy to grip, even while wearing gloves.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Allison

customer_reviews.title: Cancer & Birth Defects
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, but I'm not a fan of cancer or birth defect causing chemicals. I'm honestly terrified to use it. I don't like returning things so it's just sitting in my trunk...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Florida
customer_reviews.text: I’m guessing the person who made this Snowbrush is does not live anywhere near snow because these are awful. Before winter I bought three of them to put in each of our cars and now all three of them are in the trash. Not only are they too short to actually reach halfway across the windshield, but the bristles are so soft that they can’t even push the snow off. After two uses the bristles Are all flattened out like an old toothbrush that’s been scrubbing grout. Not impressed and the way the bristles fall out all over the car is absolutely ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: NRTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Oct 10, 2019. Denver has the first snow of this year.
customer_reviews.author: Geno

customer_reviews.title: Removes snow well
customer_reviews.text: Brush works great at removing snow (brush side) and scraping ice (smaller scraper). Handle is comfortable to hold. Only problem I ran into this as my scraper chipped and broke after I hit the corner of it. Probably user induced, but something to be aware of as these things can break off so just be careful when using.
customer_reviews.author: Adam P.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made. Top brush part and bottom scraper part ...
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made. Top brush part and bottom scraper part disconnect CONSTANTLY with use (pretty much every time I needed to scrape my windshield, I'd have to take my gloves off in the freezing winter weather and re-assemble this thing. Not optimal!!!) Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JayDubya

customer_reviews.title: It has worked great since (do not need it all that often living ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in 2016 and got the long, blue one as first pictured. It has worked great since (do not need it all that often living in CO) and I just recently gave it to a friend who was in need of one. I ordered myself a new one - this time it was red (which it clearly states the color may vary) but it was also much shorter. Luckily for me, I am tall enough that it does not make a difference. I actually prefer the small size as it's easier to store. However, be aware of this if you are specifically looking for a longer one to reach the middle of the windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: this is only for a car...
customer_reviews.text: i guess i didn't read too deep where this is only big enough to clean off a car/sedan. i have a Jeep Limited and i'm not the tallest person but i couldn't even clean the windshield from mid shield to outter. the handle is super small, heck the tool itself is small and is good again for a small car. if this was bigger with longer handle and bigger brush head, it would be just what i am looking for.
customer_reviews.author: L Boogs

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my move to Colorado even though I garage my cars. My one and only use so far was when I got back to my car at Denver International Airport and my Honda Pilot had been out for four days. The brush end was long enough to reach the snow on the windshield and to clean off the light snow. The ice scrapper end worked to scrap the ice sheet off the driver's side window and mirror. It would have been dangerous for me to try drive with the ice there. I started the car to get the warmth inside going and the ice scrapper did the job.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalPatty

customer_reviews.title: Quality material, Average usability, overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Quality material, hasn't broken since I bought it. The blade does not do a super great job on the windshield. The lines that it scrapes are about 4 cm thick and not the entire length of the blade as advertised. That was really disappointing, and it requires a great deal of time to scrape the ice off the windshield that way. The brush hasn't lost the bristles which is great. I paid extra for what i thought would be a much better tool, but in the end, i think it's overpriced. You can find the same or similar at Walmart for much less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple snow/ice scraper (brush not very sturdy)
customer_reviews.text: Pros - light and easy to weird - brush is strong and capable of moving heavy snow - foam cushion for easy grip Cons - ice scraper plastic isn't the most durable and shows dents after a couple of uses - dropped it to 3 stars as the brush shows considerable wear after 2 uses (New England weather). The bristles start to lose shape and are bent quite badly when brushing snow. See pictures
customer_reviews.author: Karan

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by the quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent scraper. High quality construction, very sturdy, and the perfect size. Will be purchasing a couple more. UPDATE: Just used this again for the first time this season (had an ice storm last night). Still works well, scraper still in tact and no missing bristles from the brush. Maybe I'm just lucky?
customer_reviews.author: Justin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Scraper has defects
customer_reviews.text: Brush works pretty good. Scraper not so much. it has defects so it has small little edges on it which causes it to miss half the windshield. Even on a side window it only gets parts of it. The Handle gripper is loose to. On thinner layers of ice, the brush actually does a better job. I'd keep looking or plan on getting something to sharpen the scraper and fix the defects in it.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, slightly better than basic snowbrush
customer_reviews.text: It's worth spending the extra few dollars on this snow brush compared to similar ones. The ice scraper is significantly thicker and more durable than the ones you might find in a gas station. The bristles extend outward at an angle from the end of the brush, which is nice for getting into crevices like the license plate and windshield wipers. The foam grip is surprisingly pleasing to hold, especially if you don't have gloves. Other than these little touches, it's a snow brush and will function as well as any other.
customer_reviews.author: Jillybean

customer_reviews.title: Get it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the most useful item I’ve purchased in the last 6 months. I live in the Midwest with a snow storm every other day. Lots of ice and the way this thing just breaks and clears the ice with the scraper side, is amazing. So easy. No extra strength needed. Then the brush side is amazing as well. So easy to just slide the snow off, and doesn’t leave any scratches on my car. The length is wonderful too. I’m 5’1” and I can reach over the middle of the windshield.
customer_reviews.author: jessica johnson

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 winter
customer_reviews.text: This product lasted 1 Minnesota winter, albeit a snowy one. It did the job well overall, but with our first snow this year the ice pick part fell off and the grip came off with it. It's still relatively functional, but I'll be getting a new one that has a better reach. It's fairly short, so not good for short people & reaching across the top of your car. A good product for the price you pay, but if you want longevity I'd recommend something else.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Really liked the reach - bc I'm short...
customer_reviews.text: The winters in Maine can be brutal and brushing off the car is necessary and it's the law. So we have several of these snow brushes. Many hands make light work. I'm short 5'4" and getting the top of the car clean is difficult but this helps. It's sturdy, it hasn't broken with the cold or the weight of the snow and the scraper is pretty sturdy. I would recommend this item to anyone who lives where there is snow and harsh winter weather.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and strong
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy winter must have for every vehicle. This appeared on my door step at a very speedy rate in a very well packaged box. It was blue and still is in great almost new looking shape. It sure took a beating with our Wisconsin weather of 54 inches of snow in just February! All together we had 87 inches! It’s crazy!! We’re eager to put it away for the season and use it again next winter. Do you think Mother Nature is ready for her long slumber? We all sure hope so here. Ha ha.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Q

customer_reviews.title: The brush is good quality and the bristles don't fall out
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Has just the right amount of reach for getting to the middle of the windshield. The brush is good quality and the bristles don't fall out. I had one from years ago and like it so much I sought out this one and ordered it for my wife's car. I also used it as a weapon to fend off a bear attack during a snow blizzard. This product is so tough that I used the brush part to fight the bear.
customer_reviews.author: C. Weese

customer_reviews.title: Narrow contact and awful sound.
customer_reviews.text: The long handle and brush are great. Unfortunately, the blade only contacts about an inch wide section of the windshield at a time as opposed to the entire width of the scraper blade making contact. This makes it really challenging to clear the frost and ice off in a clean section large enough to drive. It also makes a horrible squeaking or high-pitched squealing sound when I scrape the window. Doesn’t matter what angle i hold the scarlet handle at, neither of these things improve. Maybe I just got a dud? Going back to my regular, non-fancy one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Beus

customer_reviews.title: not good / avoid
customer_reviews.text: the ice scraper end broke in the MIDDLE (defect in plastic casting) while the outer ("fingers") are still in tact AFTER FIRST USE. bad plastic casting / i would return it if i still had the long box it came in. It looks like Michael Strahan's smile now. I'll go with the Amazon Basic one next time (NOW as I can't trust it to last even one more time.)
customer_reviews.author: Reluctant Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Scraper end kind of sucks
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I needed one with a brush since we've been getting so much snow this year. That part of it works great, but the scraper end wasn't manufactured very well at all so you have to apply A LOT of pressure to get it to scrape a full section as wide as the scraper end. Otherwise it is just points of the scraper that will work and you'll end up hardly scraping any ice away.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a good snow sweeper
customer_reviews.text: We have only used it one time. We don't get a lot of snow in town. We got it for occasional use in town but really for any travel we would do in the mountains or elsewhere. It seems very sturdy with good ergonomics. I don't know how much snow the brush will have stick to it over time. That is what usually happens but this one may or may not. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Scraping surface is too rough, doesn't clear windows
customer_reviews.text: The scraping surface is rough so it doesn't scrape well at all. So I had to buy a smaller scraper for scraping windows, and I just use this for pushing snow off the top of the car. Kind of a waste if it doesn't do it's most important job.
customer_reviews.author: shopper489

customer_reviews.title: Very long
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what I was expecting but this thing is huge. Not discreet whatsoever. I know if says how long it is, but do people actually look at that? This thing is longer than the length of my arm. Shoulder to finger tip. I have to keep this in my trunk as it doesn’t fit beside my seats or under the seats. I wish I had read the length as I probably would have purchased smaller ones. Works and the bristles on the brush end haven’t gotten frayed after several uses! Super sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Dee

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Had occasion to use the snow brush over the holiday. Worked great. Used the brush to push 6+ inches of heavy, wet snow off the car. Padded handle made the job easy, even when wearing gloves. Scraper cleaned windshield without any issues. Have not had to deal with much ice yet but see no reason why it would not work on that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnyvale Shadow

customer_reviews.title: My boyfriend and I love them. The brush helps remove the dusty snow ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a city girl who didn't see that much snow, therefore I didn't really need this. However, I now moved to the country and boy! Snow and ice (not the Game of Thrones series) is something that you see almost everyday. Winter is definitely here. I purchased two of these brushes. My boyfriend and I love them. The brush helps remove the dusty snow off the whole car and the ice scraper, well, scrapes ice off the windows. The 26 inches handle makes this convenient to reach the middle of the windows or the top of the car, without you having to get wet from the snow/ice.
customer_reviews.author: Average Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two this past winter, and couldn’t wait to try them out. I know, who looks forward to scraping ice/snow off a windshield? I did! Worked well, and great value. Plastic seems far sturdier than the more fragile ones that shatter if left in cold car. Still, best not to bang the plastic on anything if temps are well below freezing (~-10F or colder)
customer_reviews.author: EAcheers

customer_reviews.title: Have bought 3, and would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Minnesota, and this winter has already been strange, considering the amount of ice we have had. This scraper scrapes ice and brushes snow and is easy to hold. Even chopping at thick ice on the windshield or windows, I never feel like this scraper is going to crack or break. It has a comfortable foam grip which keeps you hand from sliding. The brush...brushes. Not sure how they could make it any differently. I have now bought three of these scrapers, one for each car in our household.
customer_reviews.author: Dortman

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, I have no complaints! ...
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done, I have no complaints! Compact enough to leave in the car at all times, and effective against snow, frost and ice. Keep your fancy extending ice scrapers with detachable components -- I'll take this effective, simple solution over more complicated ice scrapers any day.
customer_reviews.author: Blaise Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Not the highest quality, but for the price.....
customer_reviews.text: Quality is decent. The blue bristles fall off quite easily, after first use it left blue bristles all over my windshield brushing off even the softest snow, but I really only purchased for the ice scraper end, so found the lowest priced on Amazon and here it is. I'm ok with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stone Gaijin

customer_reviews.title: Solid for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty cheap little ice scraper, but it does the job. I wasn't expecting it to be too amazing or anything, but I've been pleased with it so far. I haven't used the brush side yet though, so I don't know whether or not the bristles fall out easily. I still recommend this for such a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: This scraper is the worst scraper I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scraper based on the reviews on Amazon. I live in snowy mountains and had a scraper that was really bad. I thought it was not possible to find a worse scraper. I was wrong. When I tried to scrape a mild frost off my windshield, most of it was not touched by the scraper. There was a line of 1/8th inch here and there that were removed, but the bulk of the frost was still there. I tried to "put my back into it" and scrape much harder, but it didn't help. I will be returning this for a refund. A complete piece of junk and waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Miss me with those cold hands
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a small little scraper to get ice and snow off my car. My hands would get so cold, even in gloves. Then I bought two of these baddies and now I can clean snow off easy. The bristles are very strong, so you can just push the snow off. Works great and doesn’t hurt my car. My only concern is that it has one of those California cancer labels, so I hope it doesn’t leech cancer air into my air and I die ): but probably won’t happen
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Texan Tested- Texan Approved
customer_reviews.text: As a native Texan, now living in NW Indiana, I hadn’t had experience buying an ice scraper... because we don’t know what that is down south. But after buying this, my windows are looking great! Definitely a step up from the credit card and coat hanger I used after my first frost! Oops!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Way better than a Kayak paddle
customer_reviews.text: So, I was new to living in snow. Only had a month of snow before weather started heating up. During this time, I didn't have a brush to get the snow off the car so I had to resort to other options.... I used a kayak paddle (haha) It actually worked really well but was not a long term solution. Bought this brush and this winter has been much better. The snow removal is much faster, which is real nice, and then if there is ice, it comes off pretty easily too! Great purchase in my opinion :)
customer_reviews.author: Jacee Whatcott

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Weak
customer_reviews.text: Ice scraped is nothing to brag about. It's a little too lightweight to be comfortable when you use it. The ice scraped really doesn't work well and the brush isn't anything particularly great either. It's just long. I'd suggested spending a few extra dollars on a better scraper, something with a good weight to it that isn't awkward to use.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Rindfuss

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a season or two
customer_reviews.text: We only had this a season or two before the scraper broke in half. We still use the brush end, but had to get a new scraper for fear using the unbroken half might scratch up the windshield/windows. Also it is quite long so a little cumbersome to fit in the back of our small car, well, in the footrest area anyway. However, it is nice to not have to reach as much to clean snow from the roof.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: It's a brush. With a scraper.
customer_reviews.text: Even while I took the brush out of my trunk the snow starting dropping off of my car on its own accord. Although I own a Honda Civic, not an Accord, so that makes it even more astounding. It works. It's a brush. Until I own a coat with brushes on the arms, this will do perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL2828

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It’s held up since I bought it in November of 2015. A little over 4 years ago. St Louis winters. I don’t really need a replacement for it too bad yet but I’m putting one in my cart for the next time I have extra shopping money. The old one can be a spare. The blades not as good as it once was.
customer_reviews.author: christie anna

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I bought this since I just moved to Wyoming this year and have already had to use it multiple times. The brush works fantastic and clears light snow easily. The blade side does not work the best and is uncomfortable to use when trying to remove the ice from the windows. Better ergonomics and a better blade would get this to 5 stars. This does great in a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: michael w

customer_reviews.title: Broke after the first use and not efficient
customer_reviews.text: Just experienced the first real New England snow fall and tried using this tool for the first time since I bought it... took an hour to get the ice off of the windshield and windows then the scraper BROKE. Now, here I am writing a disappointing review and shopping for a new brush/ice scraper for the snowfall heading this way next week. Sigh...
customer_reviews.author: 617mommy

customer_reviews.title: The ice scraper end fell off
customer_reviews.text: The ice scraper end on mine fell off, which is inexcusable. I did manage to glue it back on somehow, and it hasn't broke since -- but the problem never should have happened in the first place. (I suspect it will happen to you, too -- unless Mallory now glues the scraper end on -- which is highly doubtful). Buyer beware... unless you own some sort of plastic glue...
customer_reviews.author: James Liberty

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This past winter in Kansas City was brutal. But, I got to use this several times and it works so well!! My previous snow scraper was small, and I wasn’t tall enough to reach the middle of my back windshield. With this one, I can get all of the snow off very easily! I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Good Citizen..

customer_reviews.title: Work great.
customer_reviews.text: These are good. So good we have 2 other friends who ordered these because they were from the south and didn’t know what to get. They worked perfectly for the New England winter this past year. Tons of snow storms with wet heavy snow and they didn’t have any problems. My wife has a SUV and I have a 1/2 ton Truck and the length on these are great for getting the whole wind shield and the roofs of our vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Navy O

customer_reviews.title: Great scraper
customer_reviews.text: I moved to place where it snows often and this equipment is good to have for snow removal. It can also be used to chip ice. If the ice layer is very thin, it does the job properly. If the layer is too thick or too strong, then you are better off finding other solution.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Just right for me!
customer_reviews.text: Twenty-six inches is just right for my needs! When I purchased this brush, I was concerned that it might be too short. I have a Blazer and an HHR. However, when I tried it out it proved to be sufficiently long enough for either car's windshield and other windows! The brush itself seems well-made and the scraper will be put to good use!
customer_reviews.author: Ruben.G

customer_reviews.title: Brush is good, foam handle is garbage
customer_reviews.text: A good size, brush works well. But the foam handle doesn't hold in the cold (about 2 degrees F). Trying to brush snow off holding it by the handle, it just rotates in your hand and doesn't work. I had to hold on to the ice scraper end to keep it from turning. I'm going to try just cutting off the foam handle, and I think it'll be fine then. At least it's inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Norris F.

customer_reviews.title: This may be the last windshield scraper you will every buy.
customer_reviews.text: I like this scraper and brush combination because you never know when you may need to brush snow or scrape ice. Of course you can use it for other things because it is very sturdy and the padded handle makes it easy to hold onto. I would recommend this to any buyer.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ecoined

customer_reviews.title: Very good scraper. And brush.
customer_reviews.text: Great scraper. There are ones that are much cheaper, but don't work as well. This scraper doesn't leveany gaps on the window--I have a cheap backup one that doesn't scrape all of the snow off of the window--or leaves big streaks. Ya get what ya pay for and this is worth the money. Great foam handle. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works, slightly...
customer_reviews.text: There is a slight curvature to the blade which makes for a very small point of contact with the glass when trying to scrap off ice. Other than that, it's fine. Brush is great for clearing off snow to get into vehicle to warm it up.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: scrapper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this online to use for when it snows and gets it off my windows. Its a great price and does what it is suppose to but just wish the scrapper part was a tad wider to make it easier but other then that its something i would get if you live in the north or anywhere you have snow.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnie Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Nice scraper
customer_reviews.text: While it’s summer and the snow isn’t yet fallen I needed a new one. This one has a comfy grip, nice length, loads of bristles for brushing.. I assume it will do the job nicely when snow does fall here.. til then under backseat it remains til it’s needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: With the brush at one end, and the scraper at the other, it is hard to get a good hold on this tool to actually scrape your windows. I absolutely cannot get enough force to get the middle of the windshield because there is no where to hold onto. Poor design.. Look for one with the scraper on the back of the brush and save yourself the headache.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Extremely high quality build helps remove ice fast!
customer_reviews.text: This ice scraper might just be the best ice scraper you can buy. The brush is super soft and super absorbent, so no snow remains after you sweep an area. The scraper end is perfect - without much force, ice comes right off the windshield of your car. All of this is put together with a sturdy handle and great build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Heffner

customer_reviews.title: Let it snow Murphy please
customer_reviews.text: I did not have this after our first snow fall. Using my gloved hand to wipe away the snow from my wife's car was not enjoyable. This product is very well made, heavy duty thick plastic along the brush end. Four rows of bristles, a broom for your roof and windshield. A cushioned grip to stay securely in your hand and a wife ice scraper. Now, if it would only snow again so's I can use it. Dman you Murphy!!
customer_reviews.author: Plum Crazy

customer_reviews.title: pretty small, not very effective in scraping ice off ...
customer_reviews.text: pretty small, not very effective in scraping ice off your windsheild you might want to go for something a little bit bigger and sturdier, that said, it is effective in removing snow off your windows.
customer_reviews.author: xEricx

customer_reviews.title: Almost survived a teen in winter
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our teen daughter driving a full size truck that was parked outside all winter. Worked well, she was happy. She did chip the blade, but with teens I always wonder what it was being used for to chip it. I never did get a real answer lol. I would rate it as a decent product and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nate S

customer_reviews.title: Scraper is curved oddly but is durable and realiable.
customer_reviews.text: The thing that matters with a scraper like this is the durability - this thing seems VERY durable. The bristles are stiff enough to brush away snow and ice yet gentle enough to not damage my car. The handle is comfortable and it's shaped perfectly to get great leverage. The only problem I have is that the scraper part could be a curved a little less. It's curved in such a way that it isn't fully flat against the windshield - it's a bit annoying but doesn't prevent this from being a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Good, little short
customer_reviews.text: Good brush for a small car, the handle is a bit shorter than id like. At least it doesnt take up a lot of space, works fine but you habe to stretch. Dont buy this one if u have a large truck becuase its not long enough
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had too much snow to use this on but I'm guessing it will work well by the looks of it. I did need to scrape off ice from my car windows and since it has two sides, one flat and one for scraping, the scraping side with teeth chiseled right through the ice. Would buy again or recommend to family or friend.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon H.

customer_reviews.title: Look for something else
customer_reviews.text: Too short even for my Honda Accord coupe. Worst, though, is the fact that the scraper is at 90 degrees to the brush, which means you are constantly hitting the car with the edge of the scraper as you brush. The bristles are overly stiff, the scraper is meh, and the foam handle rotates in your hand. A complete design failure.
customer_reviews.author: MO Mini

customer_reviews.title: Foam Grip is Loose
customer_reviews.text: With so many good ratings, I assumed that this was going to be great brushing away a lot of snow from the windshield. The problem is the foam handle is loose where it can rotate on the snow brush. If there is more than an inch of snow on the windshield, the brush rotates up so that you aren't moving snow with the actual brush. If there is enough cold & snow to wear winter gloves when you brush off the snow from your windshield, you don't want this snow brush!
customer_reviews.author: JRS

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I had reservations buying these after reading issues that other people had however, I bought them anyway and have had none of the issues that others complain about. They are sturdy and do the job well.
customer_reviews.author: SeanM

customer_reviews.title: Just hard to believe products made like this. As usual Amazon was good about it ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and needed to use it early this morning. The scraper end is uneven and makes about on inch of contact with the glass. Obviously a paint trying to clean the windshield. Just hard to believe products made like this. As usual Amazon was good about it and took care of me.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Looks Sturdy And Solid - Will Return W Update If Need Be
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this looks like a sturdy and solid scraper / brush. With the windy snow and ice we can get in my high elevation area, I'll see what comes and will return if this doesn't do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: BetsyRoss

customer_reviews.title: Better than many other snow brushes I've used
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great snow brush and has held up better than other smaller ones I've purchased. A big complaint with other brushes is that the ice scraper breaks easily, but this one has held up so far! Two winters and counting. I live in Upstate New York so we get a LOT of snow and ice in the winter. For the price, you can't beat this brush!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Gartley

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I dont know what it is but here in New England the snow seems to like to snap these things so quickly. This time I was lazy and bought one online and it managed to finish up the winter well. I will say its like three times the price it should be but your-money-your-value
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Good snow brush
customer_reviews.text: Nice cushioned handle. The brush is substantial without being overly heavy, and the scraper is oriented a good direction. The scraper on this brush is oriented parallel with the bristles on the brush, which for me is easier to use than if the scraper is oriented perpendicular to the bristles. My only minor complaint is that the scraper orientation is slightly better for using left handed than right handed, but this is not a big issue scraping windshields.
customer_reviews.author: waterdog

customer_reviews.title: Failed when I needed it most!
customer_reviews.text: I woke up this morning to 2" of ice, sleet, and snow on my car. Brought out the ice scraper and it worked well up to the point where the ice scraper broke at the scraper to handle junction. I ended up having to use the remnants of the ice scraper in my hand to finish off scraping the windshields. This worked fine for light ice loads in the past, but this storm was too much for this to handle.
customer_reviews.author: SAT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product for the price,This was definitely a good pic and I am definitely surprised at the sturdiness of this product, A must have for anyone’s car Who faces snow and ice during the winter months.
customer_reviews.author: angela eastwood

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I am a new driver and so far this thing has been so handy with the winter weather Ohio likes to surprise people with. It scrapes ice really quickly from my windshield and brushes the snow off fast. I typically leave a little late for the long defrosting process my car must endure, but this handy thing saves me so much time (reducing it to 1 minute rather than 10 minutes)! Also this thing has great reach for my short stubby dinosaur arms. The shipping and handling also had those bubble bags full of air and came in 2 days. Overall wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Mad

customer_reviews.title: Good deterrent to snow...:)
customer_reviews.text: After moving to Georgia and getting stuck in out first snow storm, we found out quickly that we needed a scraper and brush. These looked ok, and had good reviews. Once they arrived, we were happy with the heft and sold feel of the handle. We through one in each of the cars to have in an emergency. We did not have any more snow after we ordered them, so we will have to wait until next winter to test them out.
customer_reviews.author: fuel98rider

customer_reviews.title: sturdy must have
customer_reviews.text: It snowed this week and I put this to work right away after I got it. The brush is great for flinging snow off my car, rather than trying to slowly scrape them off with a flat end. This isn't too heavy or light and I really like the grippy handle bar. I hope the plastic scraping end lasts against tough ice.
customer_reviews.author: Just a dad

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. I didn't have the issue of the bristles ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I didn't have the issue of the bristles falling out like other reviewers stated. My only complaint was that the scraper end was on the same end as the handle. Which basically had me grabbing the brush end to scrape the center of my windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Seth K.

customer_reviews.title: Bristles fell out right away
customer_reviews.text: I ordered several of these. They look nice but that is about it. Upon the first use - BRISTLES were falling out all over the place. I would NOT recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick for "Snowpocalypse 2017"
customer_reviews.text: Buying a snow brush in North Carolina is a hit-or-miss affair; there’s a chance you may use it, or there’s a chance it may sit on a shelf collecting dust for another January or February. When I purchased this in November, I wasn’t quite sure which one would happen, but it turned out to be an excellent buy. I was able to get my Jeep cleared of snow and ice easily, and the grip wasn’t painful to use – even with (temporarily) ungloved hands.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my car earlier in the year. My husband was jealous, so recently purchased a second for him. This little guy is sturdy. I have used to clear off my car after major snow storm and being parked outside. Small l, but mighty! This has held up to winters in Chicago and mountain west.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a full winter season already and I really like it. The long handle is great for removing more snow and feels comfortable in your hand. I love having a scraper/brush combined. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marlow

customer_reviews.title: Bought one of these and it hasn't snowed yet
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever! Get one and never have snow again
customer_reviews.author: Edward M Stumpf

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my first one like this in 2016 & had to purchase another cause my first one was inside my previous car that someone else wrecked. That being said, I liked it enough to buy it again! Works great & I had no problems figuring out how to use it (being from San Diego and adapting to the snow we get during Colorado winters). Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Scraper/Brush!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and I was so excited to get the red one, b/c that's my fav colour :) Works really well on my SUV. I can reach everything when trying to scrape, which is great b/c I'm short. I don't have to lean on my vehicle and get soaked while trying to reach the middle of my windshield anymore! Does its job, and I'm very pleased with this purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Darth Tyress

customer_reviews.title: Nice and simple
customer_reviews.text: I live in the south so we don't get snow but working night shift ice build up on windshield is common. This gets the build up off quickly and easy and the price point was great.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.  Sturdy, comfortable and effective
customer_reviews.text: Bought it and have used it for several years through several winter seasons. Works fine with getting the snow and ice off the car. No signs of problems and no arm pain. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made scraper/brush, although it is large. The fact it's large makes getting the job done quickly easy, but it does take up a little more room than the typical scraper/brush.
customer_reviews.author: DDIP

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact snow brush
customer_reviews.text: I prefer snow brushes like this that have the brush and scraper on opposite ends. There is no chance to accidentally scrape your paint if you mis-angle the brush while cleaning your car. The brush is soft, and I don't worry about paint scrapes with it, and the scraper is strong and the perfect size. Foam grip is nice, and the overall size is just small enough to fit in the trunk without taking up too much space. Wish there was some way to select color, but you get what they send. Hoped for blue, and ended up with red. Doesn't affect the cleaning, though!
customer_reviews.author: boulevard_rider

customer_reviews.title: Decently Priced
customer_reviews.text: Waited a long time to write this review. I am very happy with this purchase. I have used it for a complete Winter in a place where it snows a lot. It has held up and work the same as when I bought it
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: This is a good item
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item. We have had a lot of snow this winter. Also ice on the windshield. This works very well under all conditions. I like the length of it. The handle, with the grip is easy for my old, stiff fingers to wrap around. The ice scraper end works great, much better than most of the other ones I have. The design makes this brush/scraper easy to use. I'm glad I bought it. This is a great seller. The transaction was easy and the service great. Quick, and with great packing.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I am short and this is one of the longest ones I could find. Still not long enough to really reach all the way across my Jeep windshield.
customer_reviews.author: Mary mitchell

customer_reviews.title: It’s fine
customer_reviews.text: Simple snow brush. It is what I needed but seems like it will need replacing in the not so distant future. The ice scraper doesn’t seem to have a very even edge. Tends to take multiple swipes to clear ice/frost from the area under the width of the scraper head
customer_reviews.author: Collin Main

customer_reviews.title: Must see out the glass, this is the answer
customer_reviews.text: I'm a super average 5'7" and I can scrape the whole windshield/windscreen with some wiggle room in the middle both on my RX 300 & Toyota Prius. Obviously hard around glass with significant curves.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is...
customer_reviews.text: And in this case it's an excellent example! Ergonomic design and "nerf" foam grip is easy to control. As with any plastic scraper in the cold: don't bang the ice build up behind your wheels because these can break and turn useless to damaging.
customer_reviews.author: Jeppo!

customer_reviews.title: Works As Expected
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit leery of the low cost of this, but the reviews talked me into buying it anyway. It works just as good as more expensive ones. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dayfam

product_meta.title: Hopkins 532 Mallory 26" Snow Brush with Foam Grip (Colors may vary)
product_meta.description: Style:Snow BrushThe Mallory 532 26" Cool Tool Snow Brush with Integrated Scraper and Foam Grip Handle is comfortable and easy to use with its curved handle, comfort foam grip, and unbreakable scraper blade. The brush is 8” long and 1.5” wide with thick bristles make brushing snow and ice quick. Its compact design and lightweight body makes it easy to store and use featuring an extra wide scraper and a two-tone comfort grip. Please note that colors may vary.
feature_bullets: 26 inches long for ample reach and compact storage
Features four rows of sturdy plush bristles for removal of heavy snow
4" wide scraper blade with tough ice chippers to break through and clear thick ice
Contoured soft foam grip provides comfort and control

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,997 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
